title: How to get my child to read books with more words and fewer pictures - Quora

response.answer_text: Imagination is the key! And children have a wonderful sense of imagination. Why do we start with books that have pictures? This is to help the child visualize about the character and places. A book with pictures magnifies a child’s world thus improving the imagination. When starting with books that have fewer pictures, start by dramatizing the story. Use your own words to explain the story the first time. This feeds the child’s imagination and boosts the enthusiasm to know more about the story and to read more books as a result. There are a few words that a child may like from a book, for example, a book had the word “upsidownosis” where the plane gets dizzy and just turns itself upside down. Try using that concept while talking to kid even after the book has been read. It will stay in the child’s memory and make the child want to go back to the book. Develop your own ideas once you get a hang of what the child is interested in. Each child understands things in a different way and parents are the best to know this and work on it.

It depends on how old he/she is. Mostly start with Panchtantra, Hitopadesh, Tenali Raman, Akbar Birbal, Stories with morals, fairy tales. There are above mentioned books in market with less pictures and more words with easy language. These are the books which kids can read on their own without much difficulty.
